Hein was previously Director of Bioinformatics Research Centre at [[Aarhus University]], [[Denmark]]. Hein is the fourth son of [[Piet Hein (Denmark)|Piet Hein]], the Danish scientist, mathematician, inventor, designer, author, and poet who wrote the famed [[Grooks]] poetry collections and invented the [[Superegg]] and the [[Soma cube]]. When he was 12 years old, Jotun proved the [[Soma cube]]'s "Basalt Rock" construction impossible, which was published in the puzzle's instruction manual as "Jotun's Proof."[http://www.fam-bundgaard.dk/SOMA/NEWS/N001203.HTM Thorlief's SOMA NEWS letter: The parity Proof (Jotun's proof)] Hein's research interests are in [[molecular evolution]], molecular [[population genetics]] and bioinformatics. ==Selected books== * Hein, J; Schierup, M.
